briefdescription.para: These below macros shall be used by the user to enable/disable interrupt, when the user call the accelerometerConfigInterrupt() API.

detaileddescription.para: ID to represent bma280 accel sensor bandwidth 7.81 HZ
ID to represent bma280 accel sensor bandwidth 15.63 HZ
ID to represent bma280 accel sensor bandwidth 31.25 HZ
ID to represent bma280 accel sensor bandwidth 62.50 HZ
ID to represent bma280 accel sensor bandwidth 125 HZ
ID to represent bma280 accel sensor bandwidth 250 HZ
ID to represent bma280 accel sensor bandwidth 500 HZ
ID to represent bmi160 accel sensor bandwidth 0.78 HZ
ID to represent bmi160 accel sensor bandwidth 1.56 HZ
ID to represent bmi160 accel sensor bandwidth 3.12 HZ
ID to represent bmi160 accel sensor bandwidth 6.25 HZ
ID to represent bmi160 accel sensor bandwidth 12.5 HZ
ID to represent bmi160 accel sensor bandwidth 25 HZ
ID to represent bmi160 accel sensor bandwidth 50 HZ
ID to represent bmi160 accel sensor bandwidth 100 HZ
ID to represent bmi160 accel sensor bandwidth 200 HZ
This Specifies maximum number of enum elements and it is used only for error handling
enum values to represent Bandwidth supported by the accelerometer
Enumeration to represent the Accelerometer interrupt channel
ID to represent bma280 new data interrupt type
ID to represent bma280 slope interrupt type
This Specifies maximum number of enum elements and it is used only for error handling
enum values to represent various type of interrupt supported for accelerometer
ID to represent bma280 Powermode to normal
ID to represent bma280 Powermode to Lowpower1
ID to represent bma280 Powermode to suspend
ID to represent bma280 Powermode to deep suspend
ID to represent bma280 Powermode to Lowpower2
ID to represent bma280 Powermode to Standby
ID to represent bmi160 Powermode to normal
ID to represent bmi160 Powermode to Lowpower
ID to represent bmi160 Powermode to suspend
This Specifies maximum number of enum elements and it is used only for error handling
enum values to represent Power mode supported by the accelerometer
ID to represent bma280 range to +/- 2G mode
ID to represent bma280 range to +/- 4G mode
ID to represent bma280 range to +/- 8G mode
ID to represent bma280 range to +/- 16G mode
ID to represent bmi160 range to +/- 2G mode
ID to represent bmi160 range to +/- 4G mode
ID to represent bmi160 range to +/- 8G mode
ID to represent bmi160 range to +/- 16G mode
This Specifies maximum number of enum elements and it is used only for error handling
enum values to represent Range supported by the accelerometer
ID to represents bma280 accelerometer sensor
ID to represents bmi160 accelerometer sensor
This Specifies maximum number of enum elements and it is used only for error handling
enum values to represent accelerometer types supported
ID to represent sleep duration of 0.5 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 1 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 2 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 4 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 6 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 10 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 25 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 50 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 100 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 500 ms
ID to represent sleep duration to 1 s
This Specifies maximum number of enum elements and it is used only for error handling
enum values to represent various sleep duration applicable only in low power mode
slope threshold interrupt validated considering 1 data point duration
slope threshold interrupt validated considering 2 data point duration
slope threshold interrupt validated considering 3 data point duration
slope threshold interrupt validated considering 4 data point duration
This Specifies maximum number of enum elements and it is used only for error handling
enum values to represent various slope interrupt duration for accelerometer

briefdescription.para: This data type represents a function pointer that is used to register deferred interrupt callback.
This data type represents a function pointer that is used to register realtime interrupt callback.

memberdef.argsstring: (Accelerometer_HandlePtr_T handle, Accelerometer_InterruptChannel_T channel, Accelerometer_InterruptType_T interruptType, void *InterruptTypeParameters)
memberdef.name: Accelerometer_configInterrupt

briefdescription.para: Configures the accelerometer Interrupt referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Channel on which the interrupt line connected to
Type of interrupt requested for the specified interrupt channel
Parameter related to interrupted type. Note it is void pointer and hence the user has to give corresponding parameters for the selected interrupt y
Interrupt Configuration success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle or invalid interrupt type Accelerometer_InterruptType_E.
In case of not supported.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer Bma280Utils_configInterrupt API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: DeInitializes the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Accelerometer De-initialization success.
In case of invalid sensor handle.

simplesect.para: In case of any other error refer Bma280Utils_uninitialize or Bmi160Utils_uninitialize error codes.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Disable Interrupt type on the specified channel.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Channel on which the specified interrupt type to be disabled
Type of interrupt to be disabled
Disabling Interrupt success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle or invalid interrupt type Accelerometer_InterruptType_E.
In case of not supported.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer Bma280Utils_disableInterrupt.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Reads the bandwidth for the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Last configured bandwidth of accelerometer sensor
Getting Bandwidth success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.
In case of getting bandwidth values other than Accelerometer_Bandwidth_E.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: get the powermode for the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Last configured power mode of accelerometer sensor
Get mode success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.
In case of getting mode values other than Accelerometer_Powermode_E.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Reads the Range for the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Last configured range of accelerometer sensor
get Range success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.
In case of getting range values other than Accelerometer_Range_E.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Reads the last set sleep duration of accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Last configured sleep duration of accelerometer sensor
Get Sleep Duration success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.
In case of getting sleep duration values other than Accelerometer_SleepDuration_E.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Accelerometer initialization success.
In case of invalid sensor handle.

simplesect.para: In case of any other error refer Bma280Utils_initialize or Bmi160Utils_initialize error codes.
This function needs to be called before calling any other accelerometer API.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Reads an milli Gravity values from the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle for the UG correction.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Parameter in which the accelerometer milli G value of XYZ gets collected
Reading accelerometer xyzGvalue success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Reads an LSB xyz value from the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Parameter in which the accelerometer LSB value of XYZ gets collected
Reading accelerometer xyzLsb value success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Register deferred user callback function on the specified channel to indicate user that interrupt has occurred not immediately but at deferred context of RTOS.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Channel on which the deferred callback to be mapped
user function pointer to be registered for deferred callback
Registering deferred callback is success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle or invalid channel Accelerometer_InterruptChannel_E or NULL callback.
In case of not supported.

simplesect.para: The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Register real time user callback function on the specified channel to indicate user that interrupt has occurred.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
Channel on which the real time callback to be mapped
user function pointer to be registered for real time callback
Registering real time callback is success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle or invalid channel Accelerometer_InterruptChannel_E or NULL callback.
In case of not supported.

simplesect.para: The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Sets the bandwidth for the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object

The desired bandwidth that needs to be set, BMA280 supports upto 500Hz, Normally the sampling rate of the filtered data depends on the selected filter bandwidth and is always twice the selected bandwidth ( BW = ODR/2).
Bandwidth setting success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.
In case of setting bandwidth values other than Accelerometer_Bandwidth_E.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.

Bandwidth will be depends on the ODR as per the following Table:
Bandwidth
Update Time
7.81 HZ
64 ms
15.63 HZ
32 ms
31.25 HZ
16 ms
62.5 HZ
8 ms
125 HZ
4 ms
250 HZ
2 ms
500 HZ
1 ms
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Sets the powermode for the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
The desired power mode that needs to be set
Set mode success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.
In case of setting mode values other than Accelerometer_Powermode_E.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Sets the Range for the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
The desired range that needs to be set
Set Range success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.
In case of setting range values other than Accelerometer_Range_E.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.

briefdescription.para: Sets the SleepDuration for the accelerometer referenced by the passed handle.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the accelerometer object
set value for sleep duration
Set Sleep Duration success.
if called without initializing the sensor.
In case of invalid sensor handle.
In case of setting sleep duration values other than Accelerometer_SleepDuration_E.

simplesect.para: In case of other failures refer bma2x2LibErrorMapping or bmi160LibErrorMapping API's.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to BCDS_getSensorErrorCode API to know the sensor return code present in BCDS_SensorErrorType_E.
